intro: Erythrocephalum goetzei, commonly known as the redhead bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erythrocephalum goetzei is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
